data.title: THE MISSING 400: ON THE ERASURE OF WOMEN FROM THE URBAN ENVIRONMENT
data.meta_description:
By Way of a Review of The Architectural Review’s 2000 article “Jencks’ Theory of Evolution: An Overview of Twentieth-Century Architecture”

cc 2018...
data.text: By Way of a Review of The Architectural Review’s 2000 article “Jencks’ Theory of Evolution: An Overview of Twentieth-Century Architecture” cc 2018 an open-source booklet by Pierre Bélanger, Ghazal Jafari, Hernán Bianchi Benguria Audio/Video Collaboration with Hélène Cixous (print-on-demand ready: November 15, 2018) 60 pages 7.15" x 8.90" Produced in the United States and Canada This booklet accompanies an 8-minute videographic essay that re-examines the institutional structures of sexism and historical roots of racism in architecture that have led to the systematic erasure of women from the design disciplines of the built environment. The multimedia project features a live diagram that maps out the names of over 800 women, whose lives—as designers, builders, writers, historians, photographers, philanthropists, and more—have shaped over 800 years of urban history. Narrated by Hélène Cixous, one of the most influential feminist authors in the world, with Ghazal Jafari. Video https://vimeo.com/200606763 201
